contents-list.explanation: giving pleasure to the mind or the senses
samples: What a beautiful garden it is.

contents-list.explanation: a piece of public land in or near a city that is kept free of houses and other buildings and can be used for pleasure and exercise.
samples: We went for a walk in the park.

contents-list.explanation: a meal that is eaten outdoors especially during a trip away from home.
samples: We decided to have a picnic on the beach.

contents-list.explanation: to officially say that you will be in a race, competition, etc.
samples: She won the race last year, but this year she decided not to enter.

contents-list.explanation: a competition between people, animals, vehicles, etc., to see which one is fastest.
samples: A bicycle race will be held tomorrow.

contents-list.explanation: an object, such as a large cup or sculpture, that is given as a prize for winning a competition.
samples: He raised up the golf trophy.

contents-list.explanation: to use force to move someone or something forward or away from you.
samples: Do you want to push the shopping cart.

contents-list.explanation: to achieve victory in a fight, contest, game,etc.
samples: They won the war.

contents-list.explanation: in the leading position in a race or competition.
samples: She's still in front, but the other runners are catching up to her.

contents-list.explanation: losing to someone or something in a race or competition.
samples: "How far behind the other runners was she?""At least 50 yards behind them."

contents-list.explanation: to follow and try to catch.
samples: The cops chased the thief.

contents-list.explanation: to stop being attached to something.
samples: The handle was so loose that is almost fell off.

contents-list.explanation: moving or able to move quickly.
samples: She's a very fast runner.

contents-list.explanation: to go from one side of something to the other.
samples: The dog crossed the street.

contents-list.explanation: a line that marks the end of a race.
samples: The exhaustion was replaced by relief as they crossed the finishing line.

contents-list.explanation: to let something fall
samples: She dropped the apple core into the trash can.

contents-list.explanation: to go away from a person.
samples: She left her friends and went home.

contents-list.explanation: the sport or activity of riding a bicycle.
samples: He does a lot of cycling.

contents-list.explanation: the activity or sport of running.
samples: They go running every evening.

contents-list.explanation: the sport or activity of traveling on water in a sailboat.
samples: She likes sailing.

contents-list.explanation: a sport or activity in which people swim underwater while using special equipment to breathe.
samples: He likes deep-sea diving.

contents-list.explanation: the sport of climbing mountains or rocks.
samples: He goes climbing nearly every weekend.

contents-list.explanation: the sport or activity of riding a horse, bicycle, motorcycle, etc.
samples: We'll go riding after the rain stops.
